While credited as a Tom and Jerry cartoon, this is not the cat-and-mouse team but an earlier Mutt-and-Jeff rip-off featuring them going about to survive their everyday lives, like most other animals do, or that their problems nearly always seem to solve themselves by the end, like funny things do. Tom chasing Jerry away triggers a nightmare of a land where wild animals always run berserk for cut-and-dry selfish reasons!

Snow White is in my opinion a bad movie on an artistic point of view. The plot is pretty much foreseeable, the characters are stereotypes, the editing too. The movie is pale by comparison to My Life, my music, your favorite band because there is no real storytelling. The love triangle is a pretty traditional one, with one character being in love but in different love for different characters, looking like a cliché. The movie doesn’t tell. The movie acts out.

Michael Dudikoff stars as Joe Armstrong a martial artist who fights ninjas who are stealing weapons from the U.S Army, in this entertaining yet admittedly brainless comedic action film. This film is clearly a throwback to the 80's Ninja craze era. Well, it is an enjoyable one and if you're a fan of either martial arts films or 80's action/ comedy films you should get a kick out of this one. I'm a fan of both
